data.text:
Olga Kurylenko has had a very successful career since she entered the show business as a model at the age of 16. After covering the covers of major magazines, the Franco-Ukrainian beauty has established herself as an actress with two accolades to her name. She starred in two James Bond films and worked alongside notables from Tom Cruise to Mark Wahlberg.

Biography of Olga Kurylenko (Age)

Olga Kurylenko was born on November 14, 1979 in Berdyansk, in the then Ukrainian Soviet Republic. She was born to a Ukrainian father and a Russian mother. His mother, Marina Alyabysheva, is an accomplished artist with several exhibitions and she also teaches the arts. Kurylenko was not one of those lucky children who lived in a peaceful home with two loving parents, as his parents divorced when he was three years old. She stayed with her mother after the divorce. His mother did not remarry, so she took on the responsibility of raising young Kurylenko on her own until the time came for Kurylenko to leave his home for Paris to pursue a modeling career. She barely saw her father after the divorce. In fact, she was already eight years old before seeing him again. However,

At the age of 13, Kurylenko traveled with her mother to Moscow for a vacation, she got in touch with a model scout who quickly recruited her. At the age of 15, she moved to Moscow, and a year later she went to Paris, where she signed a contract with the Madison modeling agency. This marked the start of what was to become a very successful modeling career for the young Kurylenko and enabled her to provide financial assistance to her mother who remained in Ukraine.

Olga Kurylenko started landing modeling jobs shortly after her deal with Madison and just over a year later was featured on the covers of prestigious fashion magazines like Elle and Vogue. During her modeling career, she has had the privilege of representing brands such as Kenzo, Helena Rubenstein, Bebe, Victoria’s Secrets and Clarins, to name a few. and Madame Figaro several times.

Kurylenko made her acting debut in 2005 when she appeared in the French film L’Annulaire – produced by Diane Bertrand. Although it was her first appearance as an actress, critics and audiences were deeply impressed by her performance which earned her a Certificate of Excellence at the 2006 Brooklyn International Film Festival. In 2006, she starred alongside Elijah Wood Quartier de la Madeleine, who was part of the Je taime de Paris short film ensemble.

In 2007, it became apparent that Olga Kurylenko was poised to make as much of a mark on the film world as she had on the modeling and fashion world in just a few short years, as she showed off one of his notable acting performances in the 2007 film. Hitman. The film also starred Timothy Olyphant and after that she starred as Natasha in Max Payne alongside movie stars like Mark Wahlberg, Ludacris and Mila Kunis.

In 2008, she appeared in the James Bond film Quantum of Solace as Camille Montes, a secret agent who allied with Mr. Bond to exact revenge on the perpetrators of her parents’ murder. In 2010, she appeared in Wonderland, alongside Ben Affleck, Javier Bardem and Rachel McAdams. The same year, she appeared in the sci-fi film, Oblivion, alongside Tom Cruise, as well as November Man where she portrayed the role of Alice Fournier.

In 2014, she appeared in Vampire Academy and The Water Diviner. In addition to her film appearances, she has also appeared in a few music videos, including the video for Seal’s song Love Is Divine

Kurylenko was nominated for Best Actress for her role in Quantum of Solace at the 2009 Empire Awards and Best Actress at the Saturn Award of 2008.

Net value

Olga Kurylenko’s net worth stands at $18million. Her earnings as a top actress, along with the proceeds from her modeling career, have allowed her to build up an enviable wealth. Sources say she commands a reasonable amount that runs into the millions for her movie roles.

The wife and son of Olga Kurylenko

Kurylenko was married twice, first to Cédricvan Mol, a photographer and her second marriage was to Damian Gabrielle, an American businessman. Both marriages ended in divorce. She also dated British TV actor and writer Max Benitz for a time, but her last relationship was with a British director, Ben Cura. Kurylenko has a son, Alexander Max Horatio, whose father is her former lover: British writer and journalist Max Benitz. Horatio was born in October 2015.
